instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H_CPU: What is PPBUS_G3H_CPU? PPBUS_G3H_CPU is the .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
i got 5v, on ppdcin,  drawing 0.17 amp,
ppbus and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> cycling, found that pp3v3 is shorted to ground,
I saw a tiny hole on <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, so I remove the chip but pp3v3 still shorted, is my only way to inject voltage ? if yes can I go over 3,3v ? thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
Which is the exact ohm value of that short?
Do not exceed 3.8V if you inject voltage.

Probably the other <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip is bad too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: 14,4 ohm.., should I inject ? im a bit more careful because Im not too familiar with newer board thanks.., ordering <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> too

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
You can try, but current could be to low to heat something.
May need to wait few minutes and use alcohol method to detect if something heats a little bit more than other thing.
Lucky scenario if some chip enters in avalanche process and gets really hot...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: when  I inject 3.3v to the line, the other chip gets hot, does it only need reball / replacement ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
"Probably the other <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip is bad too."
Remove it and check again diode mode value to ground.

On the other side, next to <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is the redriver chip; many times dead with small hole on it.
Be aware, it is not present on schematic/boardview...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
removing both <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> doesnt remove the short, still 30ohm  resistance to ground..
<CHIP>U2800</CHIP> looks fine, I tried removing <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to see if the short is gone, but still the same, injeting 3.8v make the board at the right side near usb c side just a a very bit bit of warm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: Should i remove all caps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
Did you look at redriver chip above mentioned?
[url]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/52196-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a-part-identification[/url]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: Ok so i remove the redriver, and now The macbook turn on, but it doesnt want to turn on without battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
You replaced the redriver and both CD3215s correct? 

What does it pull without the battery plugged in? Both voltage and amps?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
Yeah i replaced redriver chip and both cd3215c00 , without battery it pull about 0.05Amp
, ppbus 0.5v, but not shorted to ground, without battery, and i only get 5v on dcin, does this mean my <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> is defected ? but the macbook still can be turn on, so..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
i notice when running on battery, the cpu is extremely hot, and I checked <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL> is shorted, can I inject to this line or should I remove caps 1 by1 ?
and does this <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_CPU</SIGNAL> has anything to do with me not getting 20v ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
OK, let's slow down here. 

You said it worked with  a battery, and now you say PPBUS G3H is shorted. 

Does it turn on? 

If PPBUS is shorted and the CPU is getting hot then this is done for. 

If it turns on and you get image you are getting trolled by your meter.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
Please post accurate information.

Do you mean turns on with battery alone and battery plus charger, but not on charger alone?
Also turning on means working (image, USB activity), or just fan spins?

BTW, do not check diode mode on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with battery, or charger, connected.
Allow 10-15s for this kind of test, after ANY power is removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
It Turns on means i get an image, the trackpad click, and I can login and use it for youtube etc.. but when i touch the heatsink its extremely hot.., i thought something must he shorted.., any chance that <SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU</SIGNAL> is shorted without affecting <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

If only by charger, macbook cannot turn on, but with battery, It can turn on.., I check the ppbus is shorted or not when its not connected to batt / anything

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: When its turned on, when i plug in charger, its not charging too, not drawing amps

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
It's normal. Of course it's going to get hot. Nothing is shorted. 

If you still have 5v when plugged in, plug in the USB C the other direction. Does it work? Something is likely messed up with the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> replacement or the redriver replacement.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
If board works, you cannot have any short!!!

Let the battery out and start repair process on charger only.
Post <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>, L6995 and F7000 voltages.
Do you get only 5V at USB-C meter, or it switches to 20V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: Guys, he's obviously checking for a short IMMEDIATELY after powering off the board. OP, let the board discharge for 2-3 minutes and then check for short on ppbus. It will show a short if you check it immediately after removing power. If it shows a short, then check again after 30 seconds. Keep checking and I guarantee the "short" will go away.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
There is no short at all.
Always allow some time for discharge, after power removed; if you want to check diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: Yep exactly. The "short" isn't really there. Just error from instrumentation and discharge. OP ignore it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: Sorry man, I didn't even see wasn't Yoel who posted before...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="SMMRepair, post: 56582"]Guys, he's obviously checking for a short IMMEDIATELY after powering off the board. OP, let the board discharge for 2-3 minutes and then check for short on ppbus. It will show a short if you check it immediately after removing power. If it shows a short, then check again after 30 seconds. Keep checking and I guarantee the "short" will go away.[/QUOTE]

yes this is the problem, thankss for this..

I only get 5v, it doesnt switch to 20v
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>
pin 1-4 is 5v
L6995 : 3.4v
f7000 : 48mv, thats a 0 is it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message: Post SMC_RESET_ and <SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>BUF_SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.4v
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> = 3.4v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5v not turning on
threads.message:
If board works on battery, then you still have a problem with input stage.
Try removing redriver chip.
Be sure <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips are both correctly doldered.
Post diode mode to ground on all their power rails.
Wait 30s before measure in diode mode, after power is removed (even battery).
